alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Harding County; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 7:06PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN HARDING...WEST CENTRAL UNION AND SOUTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM MDT... At 706 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Abbott to 12 miles southwest of Roy. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Roy, Abbott, Chicosa Lake State Park, Solano, Farley, Gladstone, Mills, and Yates. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Harding County; Union County
